titleInfo.title: USA v. Olivas et al
titleInfo.subTitle: MEMORANDUM AND ORDER that the motion, filing 69, is granted, and the defendant is given until July 21, 2006 to file pretrial motions. The time between the filing of the motion and July 21, 2006 is excluded from the calculation of time required by theSpeedy Trial Act. 18 U.S.C. 3161(h)(8)(A) and (B)(iv) as to Feendios J. Felix (2). Signed by Magistrate Judge David L. Piester on 7/10/2006. (CS, )

titleInfo.title: USA v. Olivas et al
titleInfo.subTitle: TENTATIVE FINDINGS OF FACT regarding Revised Presentence Investigation Report and Addendum, as to defendant Feendios J. Felix. It is ordered that: (1) The defendant's objection to criminal history 80 will be resolved at sentencing. (2) Except to the extent (if at all) that I have reserved an issue for later resolution in the preceding paragraph, the parties are herewith notified that my tentative findings are that the presentence report is correct in all respects.ETC.Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf.(KLL, )

titleInfo.title: USA v. Olivas et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER as to defendant Jesus G. Olivas. It is ordered that: (1) The government's request for hearing is granted; (2) A hearing on the government's motion for reduction of sentence pursuant to Rule 35(b) 83 has been set before the undersigned United States district judge on Tuesday, December 19, 2006, at 1:30 p.m., in Courtroom No. 1, United States Courthouse and Federal Building, 100 Centennial Mall North, Lincoln, Nebraska. (3) At the request of the defendant through his counsel, the defendant will participate in the hearing by telephone.(4) The Marshal is directed not to return the defendant to the district. (5) The defendant is held to have waived his right to be present. (6) Counsel for the defendant, if previously appointed pursuant to the Criminal Justice Act, is reappointed to represent the defendant for purposes of the Rule 35(b) motion. If retained, counsel for the defendant remains as counsel for the defendant until the Rule 35(b) motion is resolved or until given leave to withdraw.(7) The Federal Public Defender shall provide CJA counsel with a new voucher.(8) The Clerk of the Court shall provide a copy of this order to counsel for the government and counsel for the defendant. The undersigned's judicial assistant will provide a copy to the Federal Public Defender.***Rule 35(b) Motion Hearing set for 12/19/2006 01:30 PM in Courtroom 1 (Lincoln) before Judge Richard G. Kopf. Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf.(KLL, )

extension.searchTitle: USCOURTS 4:03-cr-03050; USA v. Olivas et al;

extension.docketText: ORDER as to defendant Jesus G. Olivas. It is ordered that: (1) The government's request for hearing is granted; (2) A hearing on the government's motion for reduction of sentence pursuant to Rule 35(b) 83 has been set before the undersigned United States district judge on Tuesday, December 19, 2006, at 1:30 p.m., in Courtroom No. 1, United States Courthouse and Federal Building, 100 Centennial Mall North, Lincoln, Nebraska. (3) At the request of the defendant through his counsel, the defendant will participate in the hearing by telephone.(4) The Marshal is directed not to return the defendant to the district. (5) The defendant is held to have waived his right to be present. (6) Counsel for the defendant, if previously appointed pursuant to the Criminal Justice Act, is reappointed to represent the defendant for purposes of the Rule 35(b) motion. If retained, counsel for the defendant remains as counsel for the defendant until the Rule 35(b) motion is resolved or until given leave to withdraw.(7) The Federal Public Defender shall provide CJA counsel with a new voucher.(8) The Clerk of the Court shall provide a copy of this order to counsel for the government and counsel for the defendant. The undersigned's judicial assistant will provide a copy to the Federal Public Defender.***Rule 35(b) Motion Hearing set for 12/19/2006 01:30 PM in Courtroom 1 (Lincoln) before Judge Richard G. Kopf. Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf.(KLL, )

titleInfo.title: USA v. Olivas et al
titleInfo.subTitle: AMENDED JUDGMENT (Reduction of Sentence) as to Jesus G. Olivas (1). On 1/21/04 the defendant plead guilty as to Count 1 and 3 of the Indictment. Defendant's term of imprisonment is reduced from the original sentence to a term of Time Served followed by 5 years supervised release with special conditions and pay special assessment of $100, a balance of $41.00 remains as to Count I of the indictmentas to defendant Jesus G. Olivas. Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf on 12/19/06. 4 certified copies to USM. (CCB)

titleInfo.title: USA v. Olivas et al
titleInfo.subTitle: JUDGMENT as to Feendios J. Felix (2) The defendant pleaded guilty to Count 2 of the indictment and is committed to the custody Bureau of Prisons for 151 months; 3 years supervised release with special conditions; $100 special assessment. On motion of the government, Count I is dismissed as to this defendant Feendios J. Felix. Defendant is remanded to the custody of the USM. Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf on 1/9/07. 4 certified copies to USM.(CCB)

titleInfo.title: USA v. Olivas et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER regarding Notice of Appeal to USCA, 98 as to defendant Feendios J. Felix. No order will be entered in this direct criminal appeal, and the party is permittedto proceed on appeal in forma pauperis. Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf.(JAR)
